intro: Galium flavicans, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium flavicans is often found growing in dense vegetation, where it spreads through rhizomes and forms low mats.
